website_summaries.verdict: Chlorine resistant to withstand many training sessions in the pool, this 10% spandex suit is stretchy, substantial, and comfortable.
pros: The back straps are pulled away from the shoulders for ease of movement and are fully adjustable for any size torso
Material is not see-through, even when when wet
Comes in a wide range of colors
cons: Some found the leg openings to be tight
It's not a flattering cut for larger body types

customer_reviews.title: Tight straps
customer_reviews.text: This bathing suit fits really well... once it’s on. I’m 5’7” 280lbs and got the XXL and it fit nicely when on and the material is very nice and thick. I was very surprised how high quality it is. The only problem is that the straps are so close together it is a little difficult to get on, first over the hips and then each arm in past the shoulders. However it’s so high quality and fits so well when on I can overlook that. It’s cut well and feels great swimming laps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality suit
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the suit is great. the material is thick and feels durable. I'm 5'8" 155 lbs and I ordered a 38. It's a little snug getting over my hips (and difficult to get off when it's wet), but it fits well and has adjustable straps so I can wear it how I like. When the suit came, the bra area was dented in a very unflattering way and I almost returned it, but decided to give it a try. It worked itself out after the first two swims. The suit is also a little cheeky, but when I'm in the water it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: nathan

customer_reviews.title: Good sporty suit for the price
customer_reviews.text: I haven't worn a one-piece since probably middle school, but I wanted something modest and sporty for a camping trip with my husband's work colleagues. The material is soft but still thick and good quality, and it provided good rear coverage. Since one-piece suits are more in style now, they tend to be low cut and cheeky. This one is definitely not and is more practical over style, but still cute. I'm 5'6", 34-25-36, and I ordered a SM/34. It's a little loose for me around the waist but that was expected based off the size chart, if I went any smaller it wouldn't have covered my rear enough.
customer_reviews.author: Megan B

customer_reviews.title: but this one fits great! I like the adjustable straps
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy a bathing suit online, but this one fits great! I like the adjustable straps. I wanted a bathing suit for doing laps, and I didn't want one that was too revealing or sexy. Just a utilitarian, functional bathing suit. This is it. I have a curvy figure and would like a tiny bit more coverage around the chest, but this will do. I think most people would find it's adequate coverage. There is soft padding in the chest so nothing pokes through :) For reference, I am 5'5'' and about 140 lbs, and I ordered size 36. If anything it's a tiny bit tight, but I think the next size up would be too loose.
customer_reviews.author: Clairebear

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this swimsuit! I got a large (42) just to be in the safe side but I would have been able to fit a large. Great material as well! I am 170 lbs and 5’6 for reference
customer_reviews.author: Lampkins

customer_reviews.title: Solid suit for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a surprisingly good swimsuit for the price. I bought it for lap swimming and water aerobics, and it is quality for both. I’m 5’11 with a long torso, and I typically wear a size 16 jeans, and this suit fits comfortably without being too tight or loose anywhere (it loosens up when wet but not dramatically, when dry it fits with the compression feel of most athletic suits- think sports bra not corset). I appreciate the adjustable straps, as a large chested woman.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Sent back and ordered 38 and fits great!
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered a size 36 (140 lbs 5' 5.5") and it was a bit too tight. Sent back and ordered 38 and fits great!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Nice suit but seriously get a size or two up
customer_reviews.text: Nice suit but seriously get a size or two up. I got one size up but I have a large bust so should have ordered 2 sizes up. Great fit though and SUPER comfortable for swimming.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best suit ever!
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’5, 175, and a C cup. I ordered a size 38 and it fit great! I could’ve gone a size down probably but I’m in the process of losing weight so for now it’s good. I’ll order another one once this one gets too big on me. It also holds the girls perfectly! I’m due for my cycle soon so they’ve been very tender but in the suit they don’t hurt. I’d totally recommend this to friends and family!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany A

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter. She's 5'4" and her weight is 111 lbs. I got her a 32, it fits her well. It's slightly loose in the bust and waist area for her, but she's 14 years old and still growing. She didn't want a bikini and this suit is what she wanted. It doesn't sag on her coming out of the water and it's modest for her as well. I love the quality and the price was well below the quality of the suit. I love the adjustable straps and built in bra and it also has pads to keep it from looking too revealing. Love this.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Love the suit, but pads in bra area twisted and folded
customer_reviews.text: This suit is very flattering yet discreet. I purchased this to wear snorkeling and for active swimming. It covers well without looking like a granny swimsuit. Just enough sexy! HOWEVER, the removeable pads in the bra area were NOT removeable and were NOT tacked down. I don't know if there has been a design change or if I just received a defective suit. The pads twisted and folded and were impossible to move back into place since there was no opening in this area. I returned, regretfully.
customer_reviews.author: Hollywood1957

customer_reviews.title: Don’t spend $50+ on another suit, this is the one you need!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size up and I’m happy I did, but I probably could’ve gotten away with any normal size. Was seriously considering spending $80 on a Nike suit. So happy I bought this one instead. Will buy it again when I need a new one. Bought it for lap swimming and love it!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Mirsberger

customer_reviews.title: The bathingsuit fits really nicely and the material is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I was so worried this would be to large. I got size 36. I thought I was size 34. I am 126 pounds and 5 foot 6 inches and 3 quarters. The bathingsuit fits really nicely and the material is awesome. The padding also does not slide around.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine S. Tunnell

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, great price, great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I will be buying this model of bathing suit as long as they offer it. I was so suprised by the great quality and look. I wear it for pool workouts. It hasnt faded yet and I have had it for several months. Don't waste your money on an expensive workout bathing suit. This one is great. I am 5'4" and weigh 175. I ordered a 38 and it fits great. I am a 36DD on top. Good fit there as well.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Nunez

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for lap swimming three times a week. I am 4’11 and weigh 106 lbs . The seams on this bathing suit are tighter than the fabric, and the fabric is too heavy for laps ( it holds a lot of water). Because the fabric is heavy and seams are too tight, it takes a strange shape and fabric bunches up in the middle. If you have a long torso, it might just work.
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: runs small, but a great suit
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, it's very tight. I ordered 2 sizes up, despite what the measurements recommended, and I'm glad I did, because if I'd ordered my "true" size (according to the manufacturer's recommendations), I wouldn't have been able to get into the suit. Fits well, swims well, is pretty comfortable. I don't love constricting clothing, but this doesn't bother me because it stretches enough, and it does help reduce drag. For the price, this is an excellent suit and I think I'll get years of use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary

customer_reviews.title: Finally something for a long torso!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a long torso and it's a nightmare to find a flattering one piece swimsuit for swimming laps. I almost gave up on my online search. This swimsuit is perfect for me! I measured myself and picked the size according to the size chart and it fits perfectly. The only thing I would improve are the cups, but since I have a darker colour (red wine which is BTW gorgeous) you don't see them much. I will definitely buy another one in red if my Andie swimsuit experience doesn't bring similar results.
customer_reviews.author: Irma

customer_reviews.title: Show off your rolls.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a suit with a lot of coverage, which it gives. However, it is the least flattering bathing suit I've ever worn.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Preener

customer_reviews.title: Great swimsuit!
customer_reviews.text: I am 40 years old, 5'9", 148 lbs, 34C, and usually wear Medium or size 6 in clothing. I ordered a 36, and it fits perfect! I love that there are lightweight removable cups, because I like that extra support and coverage. I just took up lap swimming again, and this is perfect. I didn't want to spend $70+ on swimsuits I was seeing in department stores, so I am very happy with the value and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Don’t think twice, this suit is perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This bathing suit is perfect for strenuous and prolonged training! I am currently training for an Ironman and this suit has really held up! I’ve taken it out numerous times in the pool and open water and does not ride and has the perfect amount of support where it’s needed and very flattering even when you may be a bit insecure about being in a bathing suit at first. For reference I am 5’4, 200 lbs, and a 38DD with an athletic frame and this was perfect. I am definitely ordering more in different colors!
customer_reviews.author: Ivonne Esparza

customer_reviews.title: Fits the tall ladies!
customer_reviews.text: This swimsuit fits amazing! I got the size 40. I'm 6'1, 175 lbs. This is the first one piece where the body is long enough to fit comfortably. It also has thin padding over the boobage area. No more having to be self conscious when I'm cold! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Kiriana

customer_reviews.title: Nice suit probably for apple-shaped people
customer_reviews.text: Based on the size chart and other bathing suits I own, I purchased this suit but n a 36 which had a ton of extra fabric in the body. I’m reluctant to size down because the leg openings were snug (in a bad sausage effect way). The suit is nice material, and I liked the style but the leg opening size is not commensurate with the rest of the suit.
customer_reviews.author: ThomShap

customer_reviews.title: Unraveled in two weeks UPDATE NEW SUIT
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed because I loved this suit! I’m a life guard and this suit is great but I’ve worn it for only two weeks and the stitching came apart on the strap and the suit isn’t wearable anymore. Geeze. UPDATE This company is wonderful and wants their customers to be satisfied. They reached out to me and sent me a new suit within a day. I changed my rating to five stars because I do absolutely love this suit and I know if something happens the company will take care of me!
customer_reviews.author: Leigh W.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but leg holes too small
customer_reviews.text: The suit is thick and good quality. Leg holes are too small and cut into me. When I go to take it off and it's wet, it's nearly impossible to take off. There's not much give in the straps. I fear I'm going to rip it soon. I'm 5'6 180lbs and wear a 36G in bras. Everything in the middle and butt fits well, just small leg holes and stretchless straps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and secure. Great for swimming laps.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve worn this bathing suit once, and so far I love it. I swim laps at least a couple times a month and usually look for a suit that has some style and also feels secure, and this is it. It’s the first time I’ve worn a boyleg suit and worried that it might ride up my thighs because I’m hippy, but it mostly worked out fine, keeping its coverage. I think I pulled the leg of it back down once or twice when I emerged from the pool and hot tub. I wear a six or smaller on the top and an eight on the bottom, and I purchased the 34 in this.
customer_reviews.author: writergal

customer_reviews.title: NOT WHAT YOU THINK
customer_reviews.text: Super disappointed in the swimsuits, I am an advent swimmer I swim every morning roughly 1500 to 2000 yards, I bought two of these suits because of the reviews. However after only seven uses one of the swimsuits seems completely fell apart - and I had to throw it away. Now the second swimsuit is starting to unravel at the seams. And I have only worn it a handful of times.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Strange Fit
customer_reviews.text: It's not for me. The body is too long, so the crotch hangs down. I'm petite, so maybe that's the problem. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Solid buy
customer_reviews.text: I liked this suit. I liked the option to remove the cups, I didn’t love how lose the top part was. Might be cause I have no boobs, idk. Everywhere was snug as a bug as a lap suit should be, for Amazon I’m impressed with the quality of this suit. I will say the one thing I don’t love is the cut of the hips, they’re a little boy shortish cut and I’ve always had my suits higher cut, sitting higher on my hips than below it.
customer_reviews.author: Anm96

customer_reviews.title: Awkward fit
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a medium because I thought the small would be too tight, it fits well on the thigh but seems to loosen the higher up it goes to the point where I feel like it might be a little exposing on the chest area, I think a swimsuit shouldn’t have to be rugged at or pulled every 5 seconds while swimming, so I probably wouldn’t suggest Buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Mascorro

customer_reviews.title: Would fit most people
customer_reviews.text: I ordered three. The dark colors allowed me to remove the breast cup inserts (I am small busted) The suit fit fine. I ordered a lighter color and the breast cup inserts were wrinkled. When I removed them, you could see through the suit. I preferred the straps on the light colored one, though. I have a large abdomen and small butt and breasts. When I wear a suit I also wear swim shorts. The bottom of one of the suits is baggy. No problem for me though. I need the larger size for my abdomen. I am sure if you are someone well proportioned, the suit would fit fine.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn K Newman

customer_reviews.title: Great suit for tall people
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this suit in the coral in size 12 and 14. I’m a size 12 in pants and dresses. I’m 5’10 165lbs. I have a B chest, thick waist, and broad back. The 12 was a little tight. It probably would have loosened up in the water but the back dug into me so I kept the 14. The 14 was a lot looser in the torso. The back was snug but not painful. The leg holes were slightly snug but not uncomfortable. I really like the suit. I got it for water sports and it worked well. Plenty of coverage and not too short.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully this helps any other ladies who order this suit. I am 5'5", a size 8 and wear a 34C bra. I purchased this suit based on the size chart and the 36 was a perfect fit. the straps are adjustable in the back. I swim laps and this is the perfect suit for that purpose. The bra part has padding between the suit and the lining. Covers well on the backside. It is not high cut for those of us who really don't need that exposure. It is a bit harder to get into than a conventional one-piece which I attribute to the straps. Certainly not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Catmama

customer_reviews.title: Good swimming suit
customer_reviews.text: I originally got a size 38 and it was too big in the breast area. I exchanged it for a 36 and it was the perfect size for me. I’m 5’10 and 175 pounds. It does fit perfectly, even though I do have to tie the top a little more because I’m 36A bra size and it still a little loose (reason why I gave it a 4 stars) I love the material and the cups in the bras. I swim a lot and so far so good. Fabric hasn’t stretched or damaged with the chlorine which is a plus. I might come back and review it again after more time, but it’s a great swimming suit.
customer_reviews.author: Sunaholy Jayson

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Swimsuit!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered mine and black and I think it is very flattering. The cups are padded - a plus - and the shoulder straps are sufficiently adjustable. I'm between sizes - where a Medium would be too small and the Large is slightly big - so this suit is a little loose through the middle. Overall it fits well enough. I think if you are a true Large - it would fit perfect. I just got it, so can't speak to durability. At the moment though, I would purchase again and recommend to all.
customer_reviews.author: D. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is so hard. Good luck!
customer_reviews.text: So I got a size 36 for my neice (her sizes are the ones listed above) because of all the other reviews, sizing chart, etc. She told me she wore a 30 but after reading all the reviews around her size I went ahead and got the 36. Well, they were way too big on her, so I ordered her a 32. She said the 32 fit great. Now she has two swimming suits so this worked out great for her. She has long legs and a short-ish torso, narrow shoulders, skinny but long neck, thin waist, small bust, flat butt, wide hips, if that helps anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Marlee

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good quality swimsuit
customer_reviews.text: I was honestly surprised with how thick the material was, I was expecting something a bit cheaper in quality, so that was a huge bonus. I actually bought this for a mommy and me swim class. The cut of the legs is a little more conservative than what is shown in the stock photo (I’m more used to competitive swimsuit cuts like Nike, TYR and Speedo) but it isn’t a bad thing, especially being postpartum. I also like that there are cups/liners sewn in and the straps in the back are adjustable. Overall I’m really satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: C. S.

customer_reviews.title: Okay for new swimmers, not for lap swimmers
customer_reviews.text: Not the worst suit, but it has a very weird fit. Bought this to replace my TYR. Don't do it. Just spend the money for the real one. The top is cut very inward, and the back is up too high for truly free movement. Before use, the bottom portion seemed stretched out, and the middle was saggy. After one use, it actually DID stretch. (For reference, I am curvy with a small waist.) It does fit true to size otherwise, but may be best suited for pear shaped ladies.
customer_reviews.author: JP B.

customer_reviews.title: Sexy coverage
customer_reviews.text: Really cute, fits perfectly (I'm a size 10-12 and bought a L). Its It's kind big in the bust area but I'm tiny... a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: shoe_diva

customer_reviews.title: This suit has a beautiful fabric, lining and bust padding
customer_reviews.text: This suit has a beautiful fabric, lining and bust padding. Even as it is slightly large in length, it allows for stretching and bending. I am overall very pleased with the look and feel of the suit.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Warren

customer_reviews.title: Nice Athletic Swim Suit
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new suit to swim at the gym and this one works great. It's slightly tight across the chest at the bands. It has some pads in the bust area that move around and aren't really necessary. I took them out. There is double fabric in the bust area which is sufficient for any problems. The suit fits true to it's size chart, except for the slight tightness across the bust, but for the price, it's a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Better than a Speedo!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on a lark, along with two black Speedos, for lap swimming. After trying all on, I loved this one so much, I returned the other two. The cut of the suit is flattering while being modest enough for the gym. I feel comfortable and supported. I am 5'7" and around 140. My chest is a 34D. This one fit perfect and the price was unbeatable. The quality of the material was comparable to Speedo IMO. I like the light chest support. I would absolutely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Not for swim meets or lifeguarding
customer_reviews.text: Not for swim teams. Can be disqualified if you wear adjustable straps and these are adjustable. The material wears out when used often. My daughter wore it for a few months for lifeguarding. Washed it or rinsed it out daily to remove chlorine. By the end of the 2 months it had lost most of its elasticity and got pretty big on her. Wouldn’t recommend for more constant wear. Ok if occasional.
customer_reviews.author: Old lady going back to school

customer_reviews.title: Great conservative swimsuit
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a regular swimmer but I needed a conservative swimsuit that would work for a dip in the pool about once or twice a week. I'm 5'1" and with a 31" bust, 28" waist, and 31" hip. I ordered the 32 & it's a very good fit for me although it might be a little big in the bust (but almost everything is a little big in the bust when you're my size). The suit material is much thicker and more substantial than my previous swimsuit. I liked it so much that I ordered another style from the same company so that I can rotate them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good suit for long torso
customer_reviews.text: I have a very long torso and this suit is perfect. I could have even made it longer if needed. I’m pleased with this suit, but as is common with suits of this design, it’s difficult getting out of it when wet. Not horrible, but just difficult. Will definitely buy again, since I swim in a chlorinated pool 4x a week. This suit holds up well, but after time any suit eventually gives up the ghost.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Made for inverted pear figure
customer_reviews.text: The swimsuit is made for someone with no behind and a large chest/bust. It did not fit well and felt very uncomfortable on me when I swam laps (loose in the chest and exposing in the behind area). I am 5'3" 122 pounds with a size 36A bust. Other than that, the material is nice as is the bust coverage, should I not do anything in it. It might fit well on someone else. I wish I had returned it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Grone

customer_reviews.title: Few drawbacks for its price
customer_reviews.text: It has a weird hem/stitch on each side of the swimsuit. I don’t know why they are there. I have a pretty narrow chest and those stitches stick out, which make me look wearing a funny swimsuit. Also, the pads came with a big crease, so even though they fit me, it still shows over my nipples. I hope they are gone after wash this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute, active, adjustable one piece
customer_reviews.text: Quality feeling material, wonderful color (deep beautiful rusty wine color) a one piece that is not stodgy but cute. On me, who lacks buns of steel, there is a bit of a cutting line that appears, just because the material and elastic of the bottoms is firmer than mine. It isn't the worst, though, just not perfect in that regard, although it does help it stay in place. The coverage in the seat is adequate, as well. I most appreciate the adjustable straps, I have a bit of a long torso, so this helps the one piece fit like it should.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hart

customer_reviews.title: It wasn’t for me, but maybe for you!
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'7 - 130lbs - 34B - 26 WAIST - 37 HIP I bought a 36 white It fit all around except in the waist. It was a bit loose. But other than that, it wasn’t too tight. It was comfortable. The bathing suit is well made. The bathing suit is as described and pictured. The bathing suit is comfortable. The suit is see through EVERYWHERE except the breasts (pads). And when I say everywhere, I mean everywhere! My lady parts were visible.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Good quality material and it's double material. The back design is pretty and practical. Most part fits as expected except for the length, a little too short, I have to keep stretching to make it feel comfortable. Next time I will try the one with adjustable back design The inserted pads moves around easily during hand wash is kinda annoying, but it's not an issue during swimming.
customer_reviews.author: janet

customer_reviews.title: A lot of backside coverage
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in 1 size larger than I normally wear due to the fact that I am 8 months pregnant. Suit works great, and is a great price. Hips come down a little low, which provides extreme coverage on my backside... which is fine since I am not trying to impress anyone while pregnant ;) The cups in the top are awkward, and don't stay put so well, but removing them does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for water sports/play!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this swimsuit in navy size 42 (XXL). I am currently 7 months pregnant, and wanted to take a water Zumba class, but didn't want to spend $50 on a maternity swimsuit. So, I found this and ordered it 2 sizes too big. It's perfect. I could've prob went with only one size bigger, but the size I got gives me some more growing room. It did creep up during the exercise, but probably bc it isn't tight enough on my bum. Boob/nipple coverage was fantastic. I mean it doesn't make your boobs look like a supermodel or anything, it just covers them nicely. I think I'll order another!!
customer_reviews.author: ASharp

customer_reviews.title: used for only 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in February and only used it until August - about 2-3 times each month (about 15-16 wears in total) only in the pool. Fabric started to become loose and it lost it's shape in June and by August i felt embarrassed to wear it to the pool . It's true that few times I forgot to wash it properly after a swim, but I always rinsed it in fresh water at least. Doesn't compare to my previous Speedo swim suit! I'm giving it 2 stars because it did look good while it lasted. I need to buy a new one and will not reorder
customer_reviews.author: Tweety_doc

customer_reviews.title: I think this fits great! I hate when you buy swimming suits that ...
customer_reviews.text: I think this fits great! I hate when you buy swimming suits that are too small in the breast area but fit everywhere else/ But this suit has padding (which I did not expect). I think this is a great price for the quality of the suit!! I am not like an avid swimmer but I do water aerobics where I jump all around in the water and I have no issues whatsoever which this suit. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: kristi carlson

customer_reviews.title: Strange Fit
customer_reviews.text: The fit is a bit strange on me. I'm a petite gal, but the top is a little too tight around my armpits/sides and the bottom is a little too tight around my thighs. The middle is totally fine though. I also have nothing going on the chest area, so the cups are also a bit unflattering on me, it's just too big and round. I swim a lot, and it's not the most comfortable swimsuit I have. The color is nice though, kind of baywatch-esque.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Great coverage, thick material and overall very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this suit. I’m pear-shaped and have trouble making everything fit. It has great coverage for my generous hips and bum and the straps are adjustable, which is perfect for my less than ample bust. The material is nice and thick. Great for a day at the pool or beach with kids when you want to stay more modest. I’m extremely pleased. Got a size 40, I’m 5’5’’, 180lb, wear 14 jeans and md/lg tops and it’s definitely not tight. I used to do team swimming and am used to the suits being very tight/snug for competition but this isn’t like that. Very comfortable, doesn’t cut in anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect - very comfortable but be weary of the bra pads
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to find the quality of this suit on par with Speedo and TYR. Fit was as expected (I purchased size 42). I wore it in the water for aqua fit and it held up well! The built in bra pad was too small for my chest, but that's expected because I'm a 38E so all built in pads usually run small for me. I am very pleased with the quality and the color is true to picture. I will remember this brand and buy more from them in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Crober

customer_reviews.title: Good suit, don't order a size up
customer_reviews.text: I like the look of this swim suit. It seems to be made of good quality material and has good overall support. I read a lot of reviews that said to order a size up so I did... And it was way too large, like so large that I don't even think my normal size will fit, I might even consider ordering a size down. It is very long in the body so anyone with a short torso might not like the way this fits. I'm 5'9 so I love the length!
customer_reviews.author: megan

customer_reviews.title: Skimpy tushy coverage
customer_reviews.text: Great if you like the Brazilian tanga look! ! .....Suit overall fits well but the tushy area is skimpy and will leave quite a bit exposed....not really the look I'm going for when I'm wearing an athletic swimsuit. Best for people with no tush, or who don't mind less coverage in the derriere.
customer_reviews.author: reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but sizing is a bit off
customer_reviews.text: I liked the color and that it felt like very high quality material, with a full lining. But found the sizing to be a bit off -- I ordered a 32, which I normally wear in swimsuits, and felt I needed at least one size smaller. (For reference, I'm 5'2" and normally wear an XS in shirts and a 34B). It is still wearable, but doesn't have the tight fit one prefers in athletic swimwear. Note that the cut is very conservative at the legs, lower than the average 'athletic' swimsuit.
customer_reviews.author: scjn

customer_reviews.title: Huge Disappointment by Month 4.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this suit when I got it four months ago. I can’t believe how BIG this suit stretched out to be. It is so embarrassing to wear it into the pool looking one size and then for it to stretch to an embarrassing larger size after laps. I have loyally bought Speedo because of how durable they have always been but I thought I would give this brand a shot. . . Very disappointed. I would never buy from this brand again. It is a shame there is such a short return window because I didn’t know after only a month how terrible of a product my swimsuit would be within four months.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan R.

customer_reviews.title: Flattering and perfect for active swimmers
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this swimsuit. The fit is flattering and she feels secure in the knowledge that there won’t be any wardrobe malfunctions when she is swimming or diving through waves! I ordered a small and medium because I wasn’t sure how the fit would be and the fit is as it should be, so I’m returning the medium and ordering another small so she can have an extra one.
customer_reviews.author: rb

customer_reviews.title: Runs big; right size is supportive and comfy
customer_reviews.text: Update: seller kindly contacted me to make things right. The smaller size fits much better and is very supportive. The 36 fits like a women’s size 6/8. Even after reading the reviews and ordering accordingly, I’ve still had to exchange for a smaller size. The one I kept was a little too big, but after a week in the pool, it’s way too big. Disappointed. It’s comfy and but not supportive enough without the right fit.
customer_reviews.author: BLC

customer_reviews.title: Basic mom suit
customer_reviews.text: Nice sensible and comfortable swim suit for chasing kids around at the pool and beach. Good rear coverage without being too old fashioned. Very little support on top, though. Didn't do much to keep the girls boosted up where they belong, so if your self conscious about you bust, you may want to look at different suit. Overall happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Katie V.

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I swim pretty heavily about 3x a week and everything about this suit is great. I’m 5’11 typically a large/12 with a B cup. This is on the border of snug and just right. The adjustable straps definitely helped the fit! After about 3 weeks of use it seems to be holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: C. P.

customer_reviews.title: extremely large bathing suit and very thick
customer_reviews.text: i am 5'9" and 135/140 lbs. i ordered a large based on the feedback from other reviews. this swim suit is a heavy duty, very thick in weight, very large suit and i am sending it back. it was very long in the torso and i usually fit into most clothing sized properly, in a regular way. i bet even if i ordered a medium or small the fit would be large. i have an athletic build and wear athletic clothing every day to spin class and yoga and i did not like this suit. sorry! it is not flattering in any way, shape, or form.
customer_reviews.author: jane in minneapolis, minnesota

customer_reviews.title: Great Swimsuit
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'6 130lbs and ordered a size 34 in black. It was flattering and did a great job of covering the necessities. It is great for professional/work situations.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Fits 5'2, 104 lbs, B chest great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'2. 104 lbs. B Chest. Ordered small. Fits great! Has a cool, sporty look. Perfect coverage I was looking for. I didn't want to have to constantly fight "the pull" where standing up out of the water pulls the suit down exposing more of my chest.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Adcock

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews and consulting the size chart, I ordered a 38 which matched the size chart suggested size for me. Got it in the mail the very next day, and it fits great! The leg holes are a bit tight, but I think for the function of swimming laps (not sun bathing or going to a pool party) that’s perfect for preventing the suit from riding up. Love the adjustable straps and removable cups. Navy color is as pictured. I hope it holds up well but at this point I think this suit is a great buy at such a low price!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: High quality, supportive, and not flimsy!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this suit. It is thicker than i expected which is great b/c there is a lot of support. I was concerned about the fit b/c I am tall and thin 5'10" so I got the medium even tho I measured for a small b/c I wanted the length. It is a little big but perfect in length which is what I expected. The straps are adjustable also. This is a high quality suit. I will order another one soon!
customer_reviews.author: SEngle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect suit for swim class
customer_reviews.text: I love this swim suit. I brought as a replacement suit to wear during my swim classes. It's comfortable, the blue color is vibrant and best of all it has full bottom coverage. No adjustment tugging whatsoever! I definitely recommend and will probably buy another suit to have on hand so that I can switch up.
customer_reviews.author: KYMcManus

customer_reviews.title: Good for swim team
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is on a swim team. She lost her suit a few weeks before swim season was over. It was expensive and it, most likely, will not fit her next year. I bought this one to just get through the season. It's quality is exceptional and it's a very cute, modest suit. I think she will wear this during the summer as well. It's not technically a full competition suit, but she is not a serious competitor. Would be great for a practice suit, and do economical!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Gotfried

customer_reviews.title: Solid conservative one piece
customer_reviews.text: I bought this suit for a vacation with my family, I wanted something my nieces and nephews couldn’t pull down, and something that doesn’t show my entire butt, this suit does the trick. The leg holes are a tiny bit tight but I think that’s just the nature of my thighs :) I’m 5’7”, 130 lbs and a 34B. I got a size 34.
customer_reviews.author: Camillion

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic suit - fit, cut, and material quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful suit for swimming laps. I like the cut and fit better than the Speedo/Tyr suits I’ve had in the past and am thinking about buying a second one of these to keep as a backup. So far it’s held up really well to use 3-4 days a week. After finishing my laps I rinse it off in the shower and put it in the drying machine, so it gets some tough handling.
customer_reviews.author: Kat_M_97531

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Really great swimsuit. I use it at the gym pool and have used and washed it many times now, it holds up well. Does come with those pad inserts for the breast and they got bent and all messed up but I took them out and it fits even better now. I am a fairly curvy person and this suit keeps all that contained for comfortable, worry free swimming.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Great fit & quality
customer_reviews.text: According to reviews I ordered a 32. I’m 5’6, 115 lbs. it fits just right and tight for regular swimming, knowing they often get loose with the use. So I’m satisfied with the fit and color. Also I really like the quality! Tks ladies for the reviews, they definitely help when shopping unknowing brands.
customer_reviews.author: lorena

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected and wanted
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'5" about 180-190 lbs (haven't weighed myself in a while) I usually wear L-XL clothes. I ordered a 40 to swim laps at my school's pool and it fits great. It doesn't hide your belly or anything, but I didn't expect it, too. It's great for exactly what I wanted. I always have issues buying one-piece bathing suits because my bra size is a 38 DD which is normally an XL and my bottoms are usually L. The great thing about this bathing suit is the straps because I can adjust it to fit my top to support the girls better.
customer_reviews.author: Mariana Otano

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at the quality of the material and its adjustable straps. It's flattering enough to wear outside of the lap pool. The fit is perfect as well -- I'm 5'7", 120 lbs., wear XS-S/24-25/ and got size 34 and it fits just right. Very pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Asia

customer_reviews.title: Nice One-Piece
customer_reviews.text: Bought to wear when I go swimming with my 6 month old. Apparently babies like pulling on bikini strings. So for that purpose, it’s perfect. Fits comfortably (size 4). I got the size that was consistent with my measurements. Love the color as it complements my complexion. Quality is great for the price. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: I’m very pleased with this bathing suit
customer_reviews.text: I never order cloths online, much less a swim suit! I’m very pleased with this bathing suit! It’s got good coverage and the material is great! I’ve tried on nike and Speedo ones in the past and didn’t like how thin they were . I ordered a 36 and it fits great! I’m about 5”7 and weight 130.
customer_reviews.author: Linzy

customer_reviews.title: ... beach for a day and found it's the most comfortable bathing suit I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Bought one in navy and after wearing to the beach for a day and found it's the most comfortable bathing suit I've ever owned, I ordered another in black. Love this suit. Flattering, fits great, high quality material. I have the skorts made by the same company and they look great worn over this suit.
customer_reviews.author: sandy

customer_reviews.title: I hate wearing regular suits and worrying about wardrobe malfunctions or ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for diving. I hate wearing regular suits and worrying about wardrobe malfunctions or yanking bottoms out so I wanted a comfortable one piece to keep on for diving with or without a wetsuit. This fits great, never moves, Have worn it all summer in fresh and saltwater for pool dives and ocean dives, by itself and with wetsuit and it has been great. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CAT

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in every way!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love everything about this swimsuit. It is definitely not too sporty, as I did not purchase it to be a suit meant for lapping. However, the fabric is quite thick and fits in a compressive way. The back of the swimsuit is very flattering, the straps are perfectly sized and the internal bra is perfect as well. I would recommend this to all of my friends.
customer_reviews.author: JimiandKris

customer_reviews.title: Good all around suit for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 36/M. I am 5’ 2”, 135 lbs, 34D. It fits well around the girth. It has some gathering/folding under the chest and midsection due to my shorter torso. If I were only a few inches taller it would fit perfect, but that is my constant complaint when buying clothing. On the good side, the suit gives me full rear coverage since my upper body is not pulling up on the suit like it would if I had a long torso.
customer_reviews.author: Boges55

customer_reviews.title: Great suit!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my teenage daughter, who is very petite (5ft tall, 100 lbs). The size 32 fits her perfectly (not too tight, nor too loose) thanks to the adjustable straps. The material is thick (seems durable), and the suit is fully lined (front and back) with removable cups — overall great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: bevperu

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, durable, great buy
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried about buying this swimsuit, as I would be training in chlorine, and didn't know whether it would fit right, as I'm a little disproportioned, but as soon as I put it on, it fit like a glove, and I would suggest using the sizing chart. The material was thick and durable, and you'd pay a heck of a lot more for it in a retail shop. It has pretty thick pads, but they are removable. The straps are thick and adjustable. The swimsuit drys fast and doesn't smell when wet. This is a great training swimsuit.
customer_reviews.author: Bryn Golson

customer_reviews.title: So unexpectedly good
customer_reviews.text: For many reasons I was hesitant to buy a bathing suit online especially as a large woman. I'm 5'9 and 220lbs and somehow this fit amazingly well. It was a little snug in the thigh/hip but I am especially curvy and carry all my weight in my hips, butt and chest which this suit somehow also managed to support. I have worn it several times since purchasing to do laps and it is comfortable, supportive and stays put where it is supposed to. Will definitely be buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Lester

customer_reviews.title: It fit great and so far holding up well
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely hard to fit. I have a large bottom and narrow upper body and small boobs. I'm a pear! I like how the top is adjustable. I've worn it about 10 times in the pool and it looks like new. I had a LandsEnd before this suit which became see through quickly so this new suit is much better than that.
customer_reviews.author: Bohemiana

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Really great suit! Thick & good material- hopefully will hold up well. I’m in the water once a week so was looking for a quality product to last, get one for yourself. Fits snug but well!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hosford

customer_reviews.title: Best exercise suit ever!
customer_reviews.text: It is scary to purchase a one piece swimsuit online as I have a long torso, soft hips, skinny waist, and large breasts. This fit perfect due to the sizing system and straps are adjustable. It has worked for me through a 20 pound weight loss . I get compliments at the gym pool often for this simple black suit. It’s thick enough to cover imperfections, doesn’t crawl up your crack, and doesn’t sour/mildew easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: awful
customer_reviews.text: i was hopeful this would fit... but it was awful. you can adjust the straps once you have it on - which is great to make it a tight fit, but you cannot get the straps loosened to then get the bathing suit off. there was also no elastic in the rear end... it was baggy. awful. so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Momoftwo

customer_reviews.title: Not a very flattering swimsuit
customer_reviews.text: It's not the most flattering swimsuit and the foam pad inserts are a strange size for the cupsize, almost like a demi cup, but then the swimsuit covers full, so it feels like the pads are cutting my boobs in half. I removed them and it is somewhat better.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberley Morey

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Athletic Suit
customer_reviews.text: Only because it’s the brand we wore on the swim team in high school, I have been wearing speedo brand swimsuits to swim laps for 25 years. On a whim, I decided to try this suit instead and I am so glad I did! It is so much easier to get off when wet and it doesn’t pinch on the hip or shoulders like my speedo suits alway have. I highly recommend this suit for swimming laps.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea G.

customer_reviews.title: True to size and color
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I like this yet. I’ve worn it once and it was fine except the straps are very hard to adjust, maybe because it’s new and needs to be “broke in” so-to-speak. Holds everything in place which is nice. Color is true to picture. I got the dark blue. And seems to be true to size which I bought the XS size.
customer_reviews.author: JBMTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great for maternity
customer_reviews.text: I bought this while pregnant for a maternity suit to swim laps in. I ordered a size up and because the straps are adjustable, it works perfectly! I also ordered a smaller size for after baby is born. Not too high cut in the leg, which is hard to find sometimes. The bum does seem like it's a tad baggier than I would like, but not to the point of being a deal breaker for me. I'm usually a 6-8/M and got the 40 for maternity.
customer_reviews.author: LINK

customer_reviews.title: Size was too large
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a swimsuit good for laps so I desired this would be a good option, being only 5'1 and normally an XS to S I expected it to maybe be too small but I have found this makes swimming very difficult as it is too long/ big ( even with straps completely tightened) giving the suit plenty of room to fill up with water which is a problem. It seems good quality though and may work better for someone taller.
customer_reviews.author: jeanne mccann

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Suit
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this suit once so far but I love it! I started swimming laps again and haven't had a suit that fits in years. The fabric is not thin, is lined, and it covers everything as it should. It does have boob pads which I kind of liked. I believe they are removable. I ordered a 36 (normally I'd be a 34) but performance suits can be tight and I've gained a few lbs recently. It fit perfectly - not too tight and not too loose for swimming laps. The price is great - highly recommend! Oh also the straps are adjustable which is nice. I'm 5'9" and am nearing 150 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Abbi B

customer_reviews.title: Shelf bra stitched down
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high quality swimsuit with nice fabric, adjustable straps, and really great coverage. However, I am 5’6” and 125 lbs and the 34 was way too big/long. I am 44 but still this suit seemed too “old ladyish.” Also, the built in shelf bra is stitched to the suit, so doesn’t really hold up the girls- more so just an extra layer and the girls could sneak past the elastic edge of the bra. I went with a Nike fly back suit instead.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie

customer_reviews.title: I bought a size bigger which was a great decision!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the purple version of this swim suit. The color looks great and it has a black lining which is nice. I was a little bit confused about the sizing chart and worried how well the suit would fit. I wear a size 12 American Eagle high wasted jeans, and I wear a 36C bra size. That being said, I purchased a size 40 and it was almost a perfect fit for my needs. For me, it runs a little big in the bust, but everywhere else is very comfortable. I recommend buying one size bigger than you think you might need because I almost purchased the next size smaller and probably would have been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Great for vigorous activities.
customer_reviews.text: This suit fits well and is flattering to my figure. It's easy to don and doff. I swim laps so it is comfortable for that activity. The only gripe I have is that pads in the bra area are free floating and tend to fold in half. A design flaw for future reference.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Boley

customer_reviews.title: Great suit for training
customer_reviews.text: This is a great suit for training. Thick, supportive material that doesn’t ride up while you’re swimming. I like the lower cut around the legs rather than a bikini type style. Very happy with this suit.
customer_reviews.author: C. Fredin

product_meta.title: BALEAF Women's Athletic Training Adjustable Strap One Piece Swimsuit Swimwear Bathing Suit
feature_bullets: Chlorine resistant; Durable polyester fabric last longer than traditional Nylon fabric
Fully lined prevents fabric transparency and gives support
Built-in shelf bra with soft removable cups
Adjustable shoulder straps give you a custom fit
Medium neckline, keyhole back, and moderate leg cut
